subject: Conventions and Cancellations
event: A couple of posts down, I announced that I had decided to cancel a couple of my planned appearances for 2015, namely the World Fantasy Convention in Saratoga and the San Diego Comicon. As seems to happen with everything I post these days, this was immediately misinterperted and misreported.  The usual game of internet telephone took place, and suddenly it was being said that I had cancelled ALL my planned appearances for 2015.  This immediately triggered a flood of emails, and comments here on the blog, from fans who had bought memberships in Norwescon or Conquest or Sasquan in order to see me, and were now worried that I was not coming. No.  Not so.  Listen, please.  I am skipping San Diego Comicon and World Fantasy Con... but as of this writing, I am still planning on making all of my other scheduled appearances.  Okay?  Clear?  That means, yes, I will be in Seattle for Norwescon next week, and yes, I will be going to Kansas City for Conquest over Memorial Day.  And so forth.  And so on. Please note that at both of these cons, I am a guest of honor. They invited me years ago, and have been advertising my participation for many months.  Fans and readers have planned accordingly.  I would not feel right in pulling out of an obligation like this, except perhaps in cases of medical or family emergency, and that does not apply here.  At San Diego and Saratoga I was not a GOH, just a program participant, attending largely on my own hook.  Makes it much easier to withdraw. It is possible that I may withdraw from some other announced appearances later in the year... most likely in the summer and fall... but if I do, it won't be from cons where I am the featured guest of honor.  I would prefer not to have to cancel anything, but that depends on how the work is going. And by "work," I mean WINDS OF WINTER, of course... but not exclusively WINDS OF WINTER.   When I say, "my plate is full," I don't just mean with WINDS.  I am still editing the latest Wild Cards volume, HIGH STAKES.   I have an overall deal with HBO, and three new television concepts in various stages of development, with a variety of collaborators and partners.   I am consulting on a couple of videogames.   There's the Wild Cards movie at Universal, where I'm a producer.  And I've recently formed a new production company to make low budget short films based on a trio of classic short stories by... well, no, not yet, that would be telling.  Premature telling. (Many of these other projects may come to nothing.  Such is the dance of development as they do it in Hollywood.  If anything ever actually comes to fruition, you will read about it here.  Till then, don't hold your breath). Anyway, I'm busy.  But please note, most of these other projects involve me editing, producing, consulting, or financing.  The writing I'm doing is all on WINDS OF WINTER. Speaking of which... after wrestling with it for a month or so, I've decided not to script an episode for season six of GAME OF THRONES.  Writing a script takes me three weeks, minimum, and longer when it is not a straight adaptation from the novels.  And really, it would cost me more time than that, since I have never been good at changing gears from one medium to another and back again. Writing a season six script would cost me a month's work on WINDS, and maybe as much as six weeks,  and I cannot afford that.   With David Benioff, D.B. Weiss, and Bryan Cogman on board, the scriptwriting chores for season six should be well covered.  My energies are best devoted to WINDS. So... back to it.

comments.article: Thank you for posting this, Sir. I'm quite frankly astonished at how shoddy many journalists seem to be these days, reporting stuff without sources or twisting things to fit their own perceptions of what people say. Good luck with WINDS, and enjoy yourself in Seattle.

First time commenting on your blog - don't you just hate it when people over interpret something simple?

Be well.
As a fan of many of your works (Sandkings is still my favorite, with stiff competition from many others) thank you for all the sacrifices you make to gift us with your creations.
comments.subject: Cancellations

comments.article: You're doing great things. Thanks for all the hard work.
comments.subject: Great work

comments.article:
Hey George just wanted to ask is there a possibility that there may be a Dunk & Egg series for HBO when Game of Thrones is complete? Because a Dunk & Egg tv series I think would be awesome and fans would enjoy watching the Targaryens in power in Westeros.

Thank you!
comments.subject: tv & film

comments.article: Reading this has left me softly glowing. Thank you, George.
comments.subject: I have a good feeling

comments.article:
AWESOME POST!

You're the man!

Thank you!

Just watched you with Sibel Kekilli, I was so hoping to see your office/where you write(Where the Magic Happens)..But Your privacy is respected.

Highly anticipating WINDS. And now Highly anticipating to see some short films on a certain trio of short stories. eg hem..

What is the name of your production company? Congrats on it.

And how would one apply to work for this production company?

I'm a director/Producer for radio(7years) and TV (2 Years)
Full of ambition and smart as Tyrion Lannister.
Are these video games based on your books, the show or another previous work of yours?

I'm not doing any of the non-writing stuff you're doing, and I don't even have enough time to write.

Pity we can't slip into a time-dilation hole to get a it of extra time in our days.

Happy writing.
I'd go for a clone. She can do the money earning and household stuff, and I'll do the fun things like traveling and writing. :-)

George, do you plan to release the Aeron chapter you mentioned back in the Worldcon? I still find it very frustrating that the audience chose Arianne over Aeron, even though you told people it had some "seriously twisted stuff" in it, but I guess people like to be contrarians.

Keep up the good work George, I cannot wait until Winds of Winter comes out I'll definitely buy it the first day it comes out on my kindle. I'm glad you don't let the negativity bother you, after all ASOIAF is your creation and you should go at the pace you feel most comfortable. Have fun at your conventions and I'm looking forward to the eventual release of Winds.
comments.subject: TWOW

comments.article:
Hello! Your entry got to top-25 of the most popular entries in LiveJournal!
Learn more about LiveJournal Ratings in FAQ.
You are one hard-working man. Thank you for the sacrifices you're making to get THE WINDS OF WINTER done. You must be gutted to have to miss those cons and GoT season 6

Not to worry George, I did not mis-understand anything. but, like you said, internet telephone, new readers / viewers and visitors to your site here.... I can understand your frustration.

I am glad that you are devoting so much time and energy to Winds. I hope that is going well for you - I am wrestling with some of my own writing, and on a much smaller scale, I can relate. However, lately I have had a flood of ideas and inspiration. It's much like playing connect the dots, but not quite knowing what the image may loom like.

All the best, hope it goes well and don't let anyone get you down or detract you from your astounding work.

It's probably for the best to set aside script writing and focus on the novel. Like you said, your plate is very full.

Oh and I'm sure those going those cons where you are a GoH will be thrilled to hear you are still going. Silly media always misunderstanding stuff.
Whenever I read "WINDS" or "WINDS OF WINTER" my eyes widened. But awesome news about Wild Cards, perhaps its about time I got to those.
comments.subject: Comment

comments.article: I hope you enjoy a lot with all your projects, and of course with WINDS OF WINTER. I'm looking forward! I hope it will be finish soon. All the best.
comments.subject: All the best

comments.article:
These entertainment sites always go for a catchy headline and people don't even care to read the article itself.
Any plans to come to Brazil?

How I wish you had less on your plate! One man shouldn't work that hard on so many things simultaneously. I wish you some peace of mind and quiet time for yourself. Too bad for that GoT script, even if yours are usually the better one ;)
comments.subject: Good luck with all of this!

comments.article:
In the movie Toy Story 2 when Al asks how long it was gonna take to fix Woody...the repair guy says, "You can't rush art."

Keep doing what your doing Mr. Martin. I wish you the best :)
George, you wrote you're consulting some video games. Does that include Telltale's Game of Thrones?
comments.subject: Consulting video games

comments.article:
Not to speak for the man, but in the past it's been mentioned that Ty Franck, his personal assistant, is helping to keep Telltale's game on track. Ty Franck is a Sci Fi writer in his own right. Google 'The Expanse' for details.

The news that there is personal collaboration on a video game, though, is encouraging. For Generation X and beyond, video games have been as much a part of their childhood (if not much more) as any book or movie or TV show. Even as games have developed by leaps and bounds over the years, I've regretted that too many Baby Boomer SciFi fans never seem to develop a view of them that goes much past PacMan eating pellets and dodging ghosts to get the high score.
comments.subject: Re: Consulting video games

comments.article:
Are you allowed to say what video games? Are they just asoiaf stuff or other ip?

You should do a Let's Play for Telltale's Game of Thrones, or the Crusader Kings II mod. It'd be fun to see your reactions and decisions. (as if you need more stuff to do lol, but it would be amaaaziiiing)

Yes. Yeessssss.

Mr. Martin, if in the future you ever want to simultaneously raise money for a charity and cause the SoIaF-following internet to spontaneously combust, volunteer to do a livestream of the Crusader Kings II Game of Thrones mod, even if it's only for an hour or so. Seriously. I think it would absolutely blow your mind how detailed it is, while also blowing the minds of the creators and fans to see you playing it.

...ok, shutting up now. Sorry, but damn if that isn't a seed that needs planting, on even the slightest chance it may one day bloom into something wonderful.

"and yes, I will be going to Kansas City for Conquest over Memorial Day"

Thank you, good sir. You're always a welcome guest here, even when you aren't literally the guest of honor. :)

Hi George,

Earlier today you posted on twitter a picture of the 5 A Song of Ice and Fire books but they were limited Deluxe Leathercloth Boxed Set. Where are these books available? You have a lot of people heavily interested.

Thank you,
PJ
comments.subject: ASOIAF Deluxe Leather Set

comments.article: Sounds like a full plate for sure.  How about Silva Lanes?  Aside from Meow Wolf's efforts, any of your energy being cast there?  Planning a trip for Q4 2015 or Q1 2016 and would enjoy a stroll through unique art.
comments.subject: Bowling for time

comments.article: I am renovating the building...  by which I mean my contractor is renovating the building. My part is writing checks. Once the renovations are done, Meow Wolf steps in.
comments.subject: Re: Bowling for time
